https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025: Republicans in Congress and the Trump administration are pushing to repeal rules requiring lead pipe replacement and lower lead limits in water. If successful, this could put tens of millions at risk of contaminated water, alarming environmentalists who cite harm to children and adults. Industry lobbyists argue the replacement is not feasible and would cost $90bn.
A new era of water infrastructure innovation is emerging, as we seize the opportunity to reimagine and revolutionize the way we protect our communities from the threat of lead in our water.
